item.ptxt: Use the same procedures for the LH side and RH side.
The procedures listed below are for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT REAR BRAKE SHOE RETURN SPRING

s2.ptxt: Using SST, disconnect the spring from the front brake shoe and rear brake shoe.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the wheel cylinder boot.

s2.ptxt: Using SST, remove the shoe hold down spring cup, shoe hold down spring and pin.
Remove the shoe and shoe tension spring.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE PARKING BRAKE SHOE STRUT SET LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the strut set from the rear brake shoe.
Using SST, remove the shoe hold down spring cup, shoe hold down spring and pin.
Using needle-nose pliers, remove the adjust lever tension spring from the automatic adjust lever. Then remove the shoe.
Using needle-nose pliers, disconnect the No. 3 parking brake cable from the parking brake shoe lever.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR BRAKE AUTOMATIC ADJUST LEVER LH

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the C-washer and lever.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR BRAKE PARKING BRAKE SHOE LEVER SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the C-washer and lever.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR WHEEL BRAKE CYLINDER ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a union nut wrench, disconnect the brake line.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR WHEEL BRAKE CYLINDER CUP

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 cylinder dust boots from the cylinder.
Remove the 2 pistons and compression spring.
Remove the 2 cups from each piston.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR BRAKE DRUM BLEEDER PLUG

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap and bleeder plug from the cylinder.
